section.title: Preface
section.para: This manual documents the use and development of Naked Object applications using the Naked Objects framework, its associated components and tools. The is primarily a reference guide for application developers and developers of the framework. For an introduction to Naked Objects and the the ideas behind the framework please refer to the book Naked Objects (by Richard Pawson and Robert Matthews) published by Wiley.
This manual is currently available as PDF document, to be viewed using Adobe Acrobat, but will be available as a printed book in due course, made available from the nakedobjects web site.

This edition of the manual is intended for use with version 1.0 of the Naked Objects framework, which works with version 1.1, and higher, of Java. The latest framework is available from the download's page of the naked objects website .

Naked Objects is free software, this means that everyone is free to use, and free to redistribute it on certain conditions. Naked Objects is copyrighted software and has restrictions placed on its distribution, but as set out by Free Software Foundation these are intended to encourage sharing rather than preventing it.

The simplest way to get hold of a copy of Naked Objects is to download it from the naked object website: , or to get a copy from a colleague or friend. If needed you can order a copy (on CD) from us for a nominal fee.
Contributors to the Naked Objects framework and associated software include: Franz Achermann, Jochen Bedersdorfer, Alan Chandler, Stephan Eggermont, Dan Haywood, Dave Slaughter, Johan Stover.
